CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 7, 1956, page 19, reads: "6. One of the most popular booths at the fair was the New Diamond Market's display. Shown here are Thomas Eisel, hostess Betty Stokes, Stanley Harp, M.A. Glick and Phil Speck"
TitMainTitle: Thomas Eisel, Betty Stokes, Stanley Harp, M.A. Glick ,and Phil Speck, standing behind New Diamond Market booth in Syria Mosque at the 1956 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Trade shows--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Food industry and trade--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Syria Mosque (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair.
